definitions: a process for prioritizing sick or injured patients for treatment according to the severity of their condition
the assignment of degrees of urgency to decide the order of treatment
the sorting of patients (as in an emergency room) according to the urgency of their need for care
a method of prioritizing tasks or problems according to their importance or urgency
examples: The nurse performed triage in the emergency room.
Triage is essential during disasters to ensure timely care.
He developed a triage system for customer support issues.
